article.headline: UAB 72, East Carolina 69
article.story: BIRMINGHAM, Ala. (AP) -- With Conference USA power Cincinnati looming ahead on the schedule, UAB coach Mike Anderson was concerned that his team might overlook struggling East Carolina. The Pirates (9-12, 1-10) proved that Anderson's concerens were valid, taking UAB to the final buzzer before falling 72-69 Saturday night. "We have Cincinatti coming up, and sometimes you can look past a team like East Carolina," Anderson said. "They played with a lot of energy and really took the fight to us." Mo Finley hit a 12-foot fade-away jumpshot from the baseline with 1:02 left to clinch the victory for UAB (15-6, 8-2). Gabe Kennedy and Demario Eddins scored 16 points each to lead the Blazers, while Finley added 10. Belton Rivers scored 26 points to lead East Carolina. Mike Cook added 11 points and Erroyl Bing had 10 for the Pirates. Finley's clutch basket made up for a turnover he had committed just a moment earlier. A dunk by East Carolina's Moussa Badiane tied the game 69-all with 2:11 left. On UAB's next possession, Finley tried to pass inside to Kennedy, but the pass went out of bounds and East Carolina called timeout with 1:40 left. Bing drove inside but missed a short jumper and UAB rebounded to set up what proved to be the game winning shot by Finley. Finley missed a jumper with 7 seconds remaining, setting up East Carolina's last opportunity. But Sidney Ball intercepted a pass by Cook and was fouled with .03 seconds left. Ball hit one of two free throws and a long desperation pass by East Carolina was batted away at the buzzer.
